title: Do all broil heating elements cause cancer or are certain heating elements more dangerous than others? - Quora

response.answer_text: I believe that what you are referring to is the char on the meat, not the source of the char. Some research suggests that burnt or charred meat may increase the risk of cancer. Substances called heterocyclic amines are formed in foods that are cooked at high temperatures and blackened or charred. In animal studies, heterocyclic amines are carcinogenic (cancer causing).
